p: Cultural beliefs (e.g. TO and SSC) will determine the level of priority allocated to perceived risk and adaptation, which will affect the individual’s social involvement (Van Niekerk & Terblanche-Greeff 2017). Subjective judgement, choices and behaviour will be affected by TO (Dissel 2007; Zimbardo & Boyd 1999). Encapsulated in the concept of time are the beliefs regarding future occurrences. Because future considerations differ across cultures, it will be valuable to investigate a community’s future view (McInerney 2004; Wallman 1992). This is imperative as climate change adaptation requires present action to influence future consequences.
